meanings.definition: A woman who conducts or directs a group or activity.
meanings.sent1: The conductress led the choir in singing beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The conductress of the orchestra raised her baton to start the performance.
meanings.sent3: The conductress jokingly pretended to conduct the traffic on the busy street.
meanings.sent4: She was the conductress of the meeting, ensuring everyone had a chance to speak.
meanings.sent5: The conductress of the dance class gracefully guided her students through the routine.

meanings.definition: To guide or manage a group or activity.
meanings.sent1: She will conductress the tour group through the museum.
meanings.sent2: The teacher conductresses the students during the science experiment.
meanings.sent3: He conductresses the team meeting with enthusiasm and clarity.
meanings.sent4: The coach conductresses the soccer practice with precision and encouragement.
meanings.sent5: The park ranger conductresses the nature walk, pointing out interesting plants and animals.
